intro: Calyptridium pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf calyptridium, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and small size, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
